Run Joint Multi-Omics Survival Models

Source: R/run_joint_models.r
run_joint_models.Rd

Performs end-to-end joint modeling workflow: builds a MultiAssayExperiment from omics data, prepares design matrices, splits data into train/test sets, and fits a specified joint integration model.

Usage

run_joint_models(
  omics_list,
  clinical_data,
  surv_list,
  joint_method = c("CoopCox", "AFTCoop", "blockForest", "flexynesis"),
  train_fraction = 0.7,
  seed = 123,
  ...
)

Arguments

omics_list

Named list of SummarizedExperiment objects, each representing an omics layer (e.g., transcriptomics, proteomics).

clinical_data

Matrix or data frame of clinical data (variables as rows, samples as columns).

surv_list

Character vector of survival variable names in clinical data (e.g., c("overall_survival", "status")).

joint_method

Character string specifying the joint model: "CoopCox" (2-3 omics), "AFTCoop" (exactly 2 omics), "blockForest" (any number), or "flexynesis".

train_fraction

Numeric proportion (0-1) of samples for training. Default is 0.7.

seed

Integer seed for reproducibility. Default is 123.

...

Additional arguments passed to the specific joint modeling function.

Value

A MultiAssayExperiment object with results stored in metadata(mae)$analysis$cooperative[[joint_method]] containing:

  • train: Training results (model, predictions, C-index, selected features)

  • test: Test results (predictions, C-index)
